Here is a pretty comprehensive sample of the books I've read in the past few years (updated September 2, 2016).

2016

  • Liar's Poker, Michael Lewis
  • The Rap Year Book: The Most Important Rap Song From Every Year Since 1979, Discussed, Debated, and Deconstructed, Shea Serrano
  • Run the World: My 3,500-Mile Journey Through Running Cultures Around the Globe, Becky Wade
  • Whatever It Takes: Geoffrey Canada's Quest to Change Harlem and America, Paul Tough
  • The Lincoln Lawyer, Michael Connelly
  • When Breath Becomes Air, Paul Kalanithi
  • The Master Algorithm: How the Quest for the Ultimate Learning Machine Will Remake Our World, Pedro Domingos
  • Excellent Sheep: The Miseducation of the American Elite and the Way to a Meaningful Life, William Deresiewicz
  • The Cartel, Don Winslow
  • America's Constitution: A Biography, Akhil Reed Amar
  • The Power of the Dog, Don Winslow
  • The Grapes of Wrath, John Steinbeck
  • Peak: Secrets from the New Science of Expertise, Anders K. Ericsson
  • Running for My Life: One Lost Boy's Journey from the Killing Fields of Sudan to the Olympic Games, Lopez Lomong
  • On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft, Stephen King
  • Originals: How Non-Conformists Move the World, Adam M. Grant
  • Give and Take: A Revolutionary Approach to Success, Adam M. Grant
  • Uncertain Justice: The Roberts Court and the Constitution, Laurence H. Tribe
  • Between the World and Me, Ta-Nehisi Coates
  • The Road to Excellence: The Acquisition of Expert Performance in the Arts and Sciences, Sports, and Games, Anders K. Ericsson
  • A Little Life, Hanya Yanagihara
  • Let My People Go Surfing: The Education of a Reluctant Businessman, Yvon Chouinard
  • This Side of Paradise, F. Scott Fitzgerald
  • The Rise of Theodore Roosevelt, Edmund Morris
  • The Brethren: Inside the Supreme Court, Bob Woodward
  • Flash Boys: A Wall Street Revolt, Michael Lewis
  • Saban: The Making of a Coach, Monte Burke
  • The Last Lecture, Randy Pausch
  • Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values, Robert M. Pirsig
  • How to Write a Thesis, Umberto Eco
  • Doing Good Better: How Effective Altruism Can Help You Make a Difference, William MacAskill
  • The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness, Michelle Alexander
  • The Education of a Coach, David Halberstam
  • Descartes' Meditations, Bro, Tommy Maranges
  • The Big Short: Inside the Doomsday Machine, Michael Lewis
  • The Nine: Inside the Secret World of the Supreme Court, Jeffrey Toobin
  • Getting More: How to Negotiate to Achieve Your Goals in the Real World, Stuart Diamond
  • Emotional Intelligence: Why It Can Matter More Than IQ, Daniel Goleman
  • Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World, Cal Newport

2015

  • A Civil Action, Jonathan Harr
  • The Obstacle Is the Way: Timeless Art of Turning Trials into Triumph, Ryan Holiday
  • Letters to a Law Student: A Guide to Studying Law at University, Nicholas J. McBride
  • Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies, Nick Bostrom
  • The Sports Gene: Inside the Science of Extraordinary Performance, David Epstein
  • Born Standing Up: A Comic's Life, Steve Martin
  • The Code Book: The Science of Secrecy from Ancient Egypt to Quantum Cryptography, Simon Singh
  • Into the Wild, Jon Krakauer
  • The Rule of Law, Tom Bingham
  • Shop Class as Soulcraft: An Inquiry Into the Value of Work, Matthew B. Crawford
  • Racing the Rain, John L. Parker, Jr.
  • The Little Book of Talent: 52 Tips for Improving Your Skills, Daniel Coyle
  • Losing My Virginity: How I've Survived, Had Fun, and Made a Fortune Doing Business My Way, Richard Branson
  • Being Mortal: Medicine and What Matters in the End, Atul Gawande
  • The Spy Who Came In from the Cold, John le Carre
  • Think: A Compelling Introduction to Philosophy, Simon Blackburn
  • Anna Karenina, Leo Tolstoy
  • Modern Romance, Aziz Ansari
  • Again to Carthage, John L. Parker, Jr.
  • The Problems of Philosophy, Bertrand Russell
  • Mountains Beyond Mountains: The Quest of Dr. Paul Farmer, A Man Who Would Cure the World, Tracy Kidder
  • The Great Gatsby, F. Scott Fitzgerald
  • Capital in the Twenty-First Century, Thomas Piketty
  • Birth of a Theorem: A Mathematical Adventure, Cedric Villani
  • Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future, Ashlee Vance
  • The Color Purple, Alice Walker
  • A Beautiful Mind, Sylvia Nasar
  • The Street Lawyer, John Grisham
  • High Price: A Neuroscientist's Journey of Self-Discovery That Challenges Everything You Know About Drugs and Society, Carl Hart
  • How Not to Be Wrong: The Power of Mathematical Thinking, Jordan Ellenberg
  • Educating for Insurgency: The Roles of Young People in Schools of Poverty, Jay Gillen
  • The Professor and the Madman: A Tale of Murder, Insanity and the Making of the Oxford English Dictionary, Simon Winchester
  • The Dharma Bums, Jack Kerouac
  • Our Kids: The American Dream in Crisis, Robert D. Putnam
  • The Motorcycle Diaries: Notes on a Latin American Journey, Che Guevara
  • The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History, Elizabeth Kolbert
  • Mastery, Robert Greene
  • Acts of Faith: The Story of an American Muslim, the Struggle for the Soul of a Generation, Eboo Patel
  • The Revolt of the Masses, Jose Gasset y Ortega
  • Long Walk to Freedom, Nelson Mandela
  • The Stranger, Albert Camus
  • A Time to Kill, John Grisham

2014

  • Zero to One: Notes on Startups, or How to Build the Future, Peter Thiel

  • This Is Not A Test: A New Narrative on Race, Class, and Education, Jose Vilson
  • East of Eden, John Steinbeck
  • Lone Survivor: The Eyewitness Account of Operation Redwing and the Lost Heroes of SEAL Team 10, Marcus Luttrell
  • The Happiness Project: Or Why I Spent a Year Trying to Sing in the Morning, Clean My Closets, Fight Right, Read Aristotle, and Generally Have More Fun, Gretchen Rubin
  • The Boys in the Boat: Nine Americans and Their Epic Quest for Gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics, Daniel James Brown
  • The Sabermetric Revolution: Assessing the Growth of Analytics in Baseball, Benjamin Baumer
  • Life Outside the Oval Office: The Track Less Traveled, Nick Symmonds
  • Creative Confidence: Unleashing the Creative Potential Within Us All, Tom Kelley
  • The Secret History, Donna Tartt
  • On the Road, Jack Kerouac
  • The Post-American World, Fareed Zakaria
  • Bowerman and the Men of Oregon: The Story of Oregon's Legendary Coach and Nike's Co-founder, Kenny Moore
  • Teach with Your Heart: Lessons I Learned from the Freedom Writers, Erin Gruwell
  • All the President's Men, Carl Bernstein
  • Remember This Titan: The Bill Yoast Story: Lessons Learned from a Celebrated Coach's Journey, Steve Sullivan
  • The 4-Hour Workweek, Timothy Ferriss
  • The Art of War, Sun Tzu
  • The Autobiography of Malcolm X, Malcolm X
  • The 80/20 Principle: The Secret to Achieving More with Less, Richard Koch
  • Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World, Jack Weatherford
  • Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!: Adventures of a Curious Character, Richard Feynman
  • The Perfect Mile: Three Athletes, One Goal, and Less Than Four Minutes to Achieve It, Neal Bascomb
  • Gang Leader for a Day: A Rogue Sociologist Takes to the Streets, Sudhir Venkatesh
  • The Places in Between, Rory Stewart
  • The Paradox of Choice: Why More Is Less, Barry Schwartz
  • How to Get Filthy Rich in Rising Asia, Mohsin Hamid
  • Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption, Laura Hillenbrand

  • Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us, Daniel Pink
  • The Last Shot: City Streets, Basketball Dreams, Darcy Frey
  • Animal Farm, George Orwell
  • Inferno, Dan Brown
  • Running with the Buffaloes: A Season Inside with Mark Wetmore, Adam Goucher, and the University of Colorado Men's Cross-Country Team, Chris Lear
  • Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience, Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
  • Lies My Teacher Told Me, James Loewen
  • Life of Pi, Yann Martel
  • The Art of Learning: A Journey in the Pursuit of Excellence, Josh Waitzkin

  • The Tipping Point: How Little Things Can Make a Big Difference, Malcolm Gladwell
  • Thinking, Fast and Slow, Daniel Kahneman

2013

  • Fahrenheit 451, Ray Bradbury
  • Bringing Down the House: The Inside Story of Six M.I.T. Students Who Took Vegas for Millions, Ben Mezrich

  • Outliers: The Story of Success, Malcolm Gladwell
  • Poor Economics: A Radical Rethinking of the Way to Fight Global Poverty, Abhijit Banerjee
